thread.title: Cavs, Thompson agree on five-year deal
thread.title_full: Cavs, Thompson agree on five-year deal

title: Cavs, Thompson agree on five-year deal
text:
Cavs, Thompson agree on five-year deal Cleveland forward's contract worth $82 million Author: By The Sports Xchange Published On: Oct 21 2015 08:27:59 PM EDT Updated On: Oct 22 2015 10:33:27 AM EDT Large Text Ronald Martinez/Getty Images 
Tristan Thompson and the Cleveland Cavaliers ended an impasse Wednesday when the forward agreed to sign a five-year contract worth $82 million. 
Thompson's agent, Rich Paul, confirmed the deal, which is fully guaranteed and averages $16.4 million per season. 
"It's been a long summer of grinding and hard work but now it's back to The Land to take care of some unfinished business. #HappyToBeBack #ALLin," Thompson tweeted. Related Content NHL roundup: Flyers roar back to... 
Thompson and the Cavaliers had not been able to end a standoff that started on the first day of free agency in July when it was reported that the sides were close to an agreement. 
The 24-year-old sought a max contract of five years at $94 million or three years at $53 million, but the Cavs previously would not offer more than $80 million. 
Cavs superstar LeBron James urged the team to re-sign Thompson throughout the summer and into the preseason, saying the situation was a distraction to the team. Thompson rejected a one-year, $6.9 million qualifying offer from the Cavs and appeared ready to hold out into the regular season. 
Thompson averaged 8.5 points and 8.0 rebounds off the bench for the Cavs last season but started 15 games during the playoffs after Kevin Love was sidelined with a shoulder injury and averaged 9.6 points and 10.8 rebounds during Cleveland's run to the NBA Finals. 
The signing could be made official Thursday. Distributed by LAKANA and The Sports Xchange. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
